paragraph.name: 目的
paragraph.desc: 说明自己试图调查什么。
paragraph.tip: 提示：每部分可分几段写。

notes.para: To find out how shopping habits have changed since a new mall (Lakewater) was built out of town.

content.para: The objective of our survey was to find out whether shopping habits have changed since the building of the new out-of-town mall at Lakewater, and to identify trends for the future.

paragraph.name: 方法
paragraph.desc: 详细描述所进行的调查研究。

notes.para: 4 groups: town-centre residents; residents of suburbs 3 miles around town; shopkeepers in town centre; traders in new mall.
2 questionnaires - 1 for shoppers, 1 for traders. 50 homes in centre and 50 in suburbs visited. Shops in both areas visited.

content.para: Four groups of people were targeted: A - town-centre residents; B - residents of the suburbs up to three miles around the town centre; C - shopkeepers in the central area of town; D - traders in the new mall.

The research was conducted using two questionnaires, one for shoppers and one for traders. Researchers visited 50 homes in the central area and 50 in the suburbs as well as a cross section of shops in both locations.

notes.para: Shoppers: 75% had been to mall twice in last month, mostly from group B. Main reasons: plenty of free parking; lots of stores in one place. Families - play area an advantage.

Group A: 2 thirds liked to be able to walk to shops. 8 out of 10 older people said daily shopping was only contact with people. Also preferred personal attention of smaller shops rather than impersonal large stores. But felt prices are increasing.

Traders: Group C (town centre) - business has decreased by half. Group D (Lakewater traders) - business steadily increasing. Majority of group D positive about future; only 5% of group C thought sales would increase in next 12 months.

content.para: 75% of all residents said that they had been to the new mall at least twice during the last month. Of these, the majority were from group B (residents of the suburbs). Among the most popular reasons cited for visiting Lakewater in preference to the town centre were the ample free parking there compared with the difficulties of parking in the town centre and the convenience of having a large number of stores in one location in the mall. Families, in particular, mentioned the Lakewater children's play area as an important advantage.

In contrast, two thirds of those questioned in group A (town-centre residents) reported that they valued the convenience of being able to walk to the shops. Eight out of ten of the older shoppers surveyed said that their daily shopping trip was their only contact with other people. Moreover, they preferred the personal attention of the smaller shops compared with the anonymous atmosphere of the larger outlets. They were, however, concerned that prices were increasing.

Group C, the town-centre traders, have seen business drop off by up to a half, whereas Lakewater traders (Group D) have recorded a steady increase in sales over the year. When asked whether they viewed the future with optimism, a large majority of group D replied positively, while only 5% of group C said that they expected to see a growth in their business in the coming year.

paragraph.name: 结论
paragraph.desc: 根据调查研究和调研结果作出结论。

notes.para: Lakewater has had serious effect on town centre - will probably continue. Parking problems in centre important - mobile customers going out of town. Centre shops only for local residents e.g. elderly and those without cars. Many businesses facing difficulties.

content.para: The opening of the Lakewater shopping centre has clearly had a devastating effect on the town centre, and this trend seems set to continue. Parking problems in the town centre have been a significant factor in changing people's habits. Mobile, better-off consumers are deserting the high street for the new mall, leaving the town-centre traders relying on the custom of local residents, particularly the elderly and those without cars. As a result, many long-established businesses now face grave difficulties.
